subject: AI & Agents
title: Logging Predictions for Auditing
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Logging Predictions for Auditing.

hook.text: A user says your model gave a wrong prediction last Tuesday. Can you reproduce it?

buildup.text: Prediction logging stores every input, output, model version, and timestamp.

discovery.text: Logs enable debugging, auditing, retraining on production data, and compliance reporting.

twist.text: Logging everything is expensive at scale. Sample strategicallyâ€”100% for errors, 1% for normal.

climax.text: Store logs in a queryable format (BigQuery, S3 + Athena) for easy analysis.

punchline.text: Log the prediction. Debug it later.

quiz.question: Why should you log predictions at different sample rates?
options: 100% logging at scale is too expensive
